poem:
### Three Vicars at the Cinema

Three vicars,  
collars tight,  
sit in shadowed rows—  
screen flickers,  
a man's truth unravels  
in the soft darkness.   

A chorus of tics,  
unexpected grace in  
each audible gasp—  
the quiet lesson of  
unasked revelation,  
tolerance whispers  
between popcorn breaths.
